sponsor: Alliance for Clinical Trials in Oncology
briefTitle: Laparoscopic-Assisted Resection or Open Resection in Treating Patients With Rectal Cancer
officialTitle: A Phase III Prospective Randomized Trial Comparing Laparoscopic-Assisted Resection Versus Open Resection for Rectal Cancer

arms.label: Arm 1: Open laparotomy and rectal resection

summary: This study is being done to compare two types of surgery currently used for rectal cancer. The two types of surgery are laparoscopic-assisted rectal resection and open laparotomy rectal resection. Although laparoscopic-assisted rectal resection is being used for rectal cancer in some medical centers, the effectiveness of this type of surgery compared to open surgery is unknown. The study will compare the safety and effectiveness of the surgeries, recovery from surgery in the hospital, overall recovery from surgery and cancer outcome.

primaryOutcome.measure: Comparing Laparoscopic-assisted Resection to Open Rectal Resection for Rectal Cancer as Measured by the Percentage of Patients With Successful Resection Based on Pathological Evaluation.

effectByArm.arm: Arm 1: Open Laparotomy and Rectal Resection
